text:
Name: Archaeological Park and Ruins of Quirigua. short_description:

Inhabited since the 2nd century A.D., Quirigua had become during the reign of Cauac Sky (723â€“84) the capital of an autonomous and prosperous state. The ruins of Quirigua contain some outstanding 8th-century monuments and an impressive series of carved stelae and sculpted calendars that constitute an essential source for the study of Mayan civilization.
